private_information: I can move disks A B C D E
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves so that the final configuration is left peg top-to-bottom B D E F G H I J, middle peg empty, right peg top-to-bottom A C

private_information: I can move disks F G H I J
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves so that the final configuration is left peg top-to-bottom B D E F G H I J, middle peg empty, right peg top-to-bottom A C

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver
I must ensure agent actions remain distinct and that the generated PDDL encodes agent-specific move permissions
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' move sequences and produce a FastDownward-compatible PDDL domain and problem that capture the multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance and lead to the requested goal

public_information: There are 3 pegs: left, middle, right
There are 10 disks labeled A B C D E F G H I J with A smallest and J largest
Initial configuration left peg top-to-bottom A B C D E F G H I J, middle peg empty, right peg empty
Goal configuration left peg top-to-bottom B D E F G H I J, middle peg empty, right peg top-to-bottom A C
Tower of Hanoi rules apply: move exactly one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
Agent movement restrictions: agent_1 may move A B C D E and agent_2 may move F G H I J
Moves must be expressed as primitive moves of the form 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You know which disks you are allowed to move and you must produce a valid ordered list of primitive moves that respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and your movement restrictions. Do not produce PDDL. Produce only the ordered list of moves as plain text lines each following the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Ensure each move is legal given the current configuration and the preceding moves.
moves.prompt: You are agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information} Private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information} Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal} Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Use only disks A B C D E. Keep moves minimal and legal. Output one move per line in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You know which disks you are allowed to move and you must produce a valid ordered list of primitive moves that respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and your movement restrictions. Do not produce PDDL. Produce only the ordered list of moves as plain text lines each following the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Ensure each move is legal given the current configuration and the preceding moves.
moves.prompt: You are agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information} Private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information} Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal} Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Use only disks F G H I J. Keep moves minimal and legal. Output one move per line in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Your job is to integrate the ordered primitive moves from agent_1 and agent_2 and produce a single PDDL domain and PDDL problem compatible with the FastDownward planner. The generated PDDL must represent pegs, disks, legal move preconditions and effects, and agent-specific permissions so that only agent_1 can perform actions that move disks A B C D E and only agent_2 can perform actions that move disks F G H I J. Keep all actions distinct per agent. Target a STRIPS-compatible subset accepted by FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Here are the public facts about the instance: {environment->public_information} Here is agent_1's ordered move list: {moves_agent_1} Here is agent_2's ordered move list: {moves_agent_2} Integrate these move lists into a coherent plan and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that represent the multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance and that are compatible with the FastDownward solver. Ensure actions remain distinct for each agent and encode permissions so that each agent may only execute their allowed disk moves. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
